page.title: 15CANAL, THATCHAM.
page.content: The Kennet and Avon Canal sometimes joins the River Kennet but more often than not makes its own way from West to East on the south of Thatcham. The canal was originally opened in 1810 extending from Reading to Bristol. In 1841 the Great Western Railway was opened and it was not long before traffic on the canal started to decline. The canal is now being restored and only 3 stretches require attention before it can be opened to traffic entirely from the Bristol Channel right through to the River Thames at Reading. One of these stretches is in the Thatcham area. It comprises the length between Monkey Marsh Lock and Midgham Lock.
